greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Table of tersums m + n (answers written in base 10).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals d = 0..140, flattened
formula: Tersum m + n: write m and n in base 3 and add mod 3 with no carries, e.g. 5 + 8 = "21" + "22" = "10" = 1.
maple: T:= proc(n, m) local t, h, r, i;
for i from 0 while t>0 or h>0 do
seq(seq(T(n, d-n), n=0..d), d=0..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 07 2011
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := Module[{t, h, r, i, remt, remh}, {t, h, r} = {n, m, 0}; For[i = 0, t>0 || h>0, i++, r = r + 3^i*Mod[({t, remt} = QuotientRemainder[t, 3 ]; remt) + ({h, remh} = QuotientRemainder[h, 3]; remh), 3]]; r]; Table[Table[T[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 13}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 07 2014, translated from Maple *)
program: print([T(n, d-n) for d in range(14) for n in range(d+1)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, May 04 2021
xref: Similar to but different from A004481.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
ext: More terms from Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Jan 23 2001
